sections.abstract: Automated imaging payloads captured time-series datasets to quantify phenotypic drift under extended orbital exposure. Radiation shielding strategies were evaluated alongside transcriptomic profiling to identify mission-critical biomarkers. Automated imaging payloads captured time-series datasets to quantify phenotypic drift under extended orbital exposure.
sections.methods: Radiation shielding strategies were evaluated alongside transcriptomic profiling to identify mission-critical biomarkers. Crew-operated assays validated ground-based analog simulations, highlighting variance in nutrient uptake kinetics. Crew-operated assays validated ground-based analog simulations, highlighting variance in nutrient uptake kinetics.
sections.results: Radiation shielding strategies were evaluated alongside transcriptomic profiling to identify mission-critical biomarkers. Microgravity environments alter cellular morphology and biochemical signaling cascades, prompting adaptive responses across multiple organ systems.
sections.conclusion: Automated imaging payloads captured time-series datasets to quantify phenotypic drift under extended orbital exposure. Radiation shielding strategies were evaluated alongside transcriptomic profiling to identify mission-critical biomarkers.
